sentence.Network_en: We tend to imagine that the Victorians were very prim and proper.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们倾向于把维多利亚时代的人想象得非常古板、中规中矩。

sentence.Network_en: On her blonde wavy hair, the white hat looked nicely prim.
sentence.Network_cn: 这顶白色的帽子戴在她金色的卷发上显得非常雅致。

sentence.Network_en: You can't tell her that joke—she's much too prim and proper .
sentence.Network_cn: 你可别跟她讲那个笑话，她这个人古板正经得要命。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (as a verb): probably ultimately from Old French prin, Provençal prim 'excellent, delicate', from Latin primus 'first'

entry.tran: 极拘谨的；一本正经的；古板的
entry.def: If you describe someone as prim, you disapprove of them because they behave too correctly and are too easily shocked by anything rude.

example.ex: We tend to imagine that the Victorians were very prim and proper.
example.tran: 我们倾向于把维多利亚时代的人想象得非常古板、中规中矩。
一位极为古板的英国老处女

entry.def: If you describe something as prim, you mean that it is very neat, tidy, or sensible.

example.ex: On her blonde wavy hair, the white hat looked nicely prim.
example.tran: 这顶白色的帽子戴在她金色的卷发上显得非常雅致。

sentences.sentence: "She primmed her lips after every bite of food"
"my straitlaced Aunt Anna doesn't approve of my miniskirts"

auth_sentence.content: She was lovely but much more prim than me.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was lovely but much more prim than me.

auth_sentence.content: His ladies were prim to the point of austerity.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 初级的，原发的，基本的，主要的

sentences.en: It was a strange conjunction—the prim serious young Queen and the elderly,cynical Whig.
sentences.cn: 那是奇特的组合——古板严肃的年轻女王和上了年纪、玩世不恭的维新党成员相组合。

sentences.en: She’s too prim to enjoy rude jokes!
sentences.cn: 她太古板,不喜欢听粗野的笑话！

sentences.en: Don’t invite her to the party. She’s so prim and proper.
sentences.cn: 别请她去舞会，她太古板了。
